nrs_orr_data Struct Reference

private data structure for ORR and TRR NRS More...

Data Fields

struct ptlrpc_nrs_resource od_res
struct cfs_binheap * od_binheap
struct cfs_hash * od_obj_hash
struct kmem_cache * od_cache
__u64 od_round
 Used when a new scheduling round commences, in order to synchronize all object or OST batches with the new round number.
__u64 od_sequence
 Determines the relevant ordering amongst request batches within a scheduling round.
enum nrs_orr_supp od_supp
 RPC types that are currently supported.
__u16 od_quantum
 Round Robin quantum; the maxium number of RPCs that each request batch for each object or OST can have in a scheduling round.
bool od_physical
 Whether to use physical disk offsets or logical file offsets.
char od_objname [NRS_ORR_OBJ_NAME_MAX]
 XXX: We need to provide a persistently allocated string to hold unique object names for this policy, since in currently supported versions of Linux by Lustre, kmem_cache_create() just sets a pointer to the name string provided.

Definition at line 110 of file lustre_nrs_orr.h.

char nrs_orr_data::od_objname[NRS_ORR_OBJ_NAME_MAX]

XXX: We need to provide a persistently allocated string to hold unique object names for this policy, since in currently supported versions of Linux by Lustre, kmem_cache_create() just sets a pointer to the name string provided.

kstrdup() is used in the version of kmeme_cache_create() in current Linux mainline, so we may be able to remove this in the future.
